newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Sapphires found in Ireland by UK Cambridge - paper.
newsitem.headline: Sapphires found in Ireland by UK Cambridge - paper.

text.p: Cambridge Mineral Resources, a British exploration company, has found a small quantitiy of sapphires in the northerly Irish county of Donegal, the Irish Times reported on Thursday.
The sapphires were found in three rivers the Malin, Carndonagh and Culdaff, in the company's Irishowen licence area, the report said.
Cambridge said minerals were present at all sample locations, diamond indicator minerals were identified at two sample locations and small blue sapphires were discovered at one location.
Cambridge expects its shares to trade on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM) on Friday March 7, the report said.
